title: Why do water droplets has circular shape? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is because of surface tension. Surface (exposed to atmospheric air) of the liquid behaves like a streched membrane. Surface tension is a property of liquid due to which it tends to decrease (minimise) its surface area. For a given volume, sphere has minimum surface area. Thats why water drops have spherical (not circular) shape. Think of balloon. Its a streched membrane. It represents the streched surface if water.

Surface tension is responsible for the shape of liquid droplets. Although easily deformed, droplets of water tend to be pulled into a spherical shape by the cohesive forces of the surface layer. In the absence of other forces, including gravity, drops of virtually all liquids would be approximately spherical.
